data.title: Happy Birthday Kamal Haasan: 7 must
data.meta_description: Kamal Haasan is celebrating his 69th birthday on Tuesday, November 7. A day before his birthday he revealed the title and first look poster of one of his upcoming films 'KH 234,' renamed 'Thug Life,' directed by Mani Ratnam. The movie will mark the resumption of the iconic actor-director collaboration after a little short of four decades.
data.text:
Superstar Kamal Haasan is known as one of the finest actors in Indian cinema. The veteran actor is celebrating his 69th birthday on Tuesday, November 7. In a career spanning over five decades the actor has worked in films across languages, including Malayalam, Hindi, Telugu, Kannada and Bengali, while being prominently active in the Tamil film industry. Besides his excellent acting, Kamal Haasan has also been a successful filmmaker, producer, screenwriter and playback singer.

The veteran actor is gearing up for the release of his upcoming film Indian 2, which is expected to hit theatres soon.

Meanwhile, a day before his birthday, Kamal Haasan revealed the title and first look poster of one of his upcoming films KH 234, now renamed Thug Life, directed by Mani Ratnam. The movie will mark the resumption of the iconic actor-director collaboration after a long 36 years.

Kamal Haasan was born on November 7, 1954, to a Tamil Iyengar Brahmin family. At an early age of six years, Haasan made his debut as a child actor with the Tamil film Kalathur Kannamma in 1960, which was directed by A. Bhimsingh.

Here are some of the most successful movies featuring Kamal Haasan, that you should not miss:

Vikram, 2022

The Tamil action drama was released pan-India with dubbed versions in Telugu, Malayalam, Kannada and Hindi languages. The film revolves around a series of murder investigations. Besides Kamal Haasan, Vikram features Fahadh Faasil, Vijay Sethupathi, Kalidas Jayaram and Suriya, among others. The 2022 released movie, helmed by Lokesh Kanagaraj, is considered to be a part of Lokesh Cinematic Universe (LCU).

Indian, 1996

Indian is a story of an ex-freedom fighter, who transforms himself into a vigilante for fighting against corruption in society. The film centres on the themes of justice, patriotism, and social reform. Alongside Haasan, the film features Manisha Koirala, Sukanya and Urmila Matondkar in crucial roles.

Dasavatharam, 2008

One of Kamal Haasan’s most loved movies, Dasavatharam, is a science fiction film. In the film, the actor played 10 different roles, showcasing his remarkable performance as an actor. The movie was released in 2008, which narrated the story of a bio-scientist played by Haasan. It features Asin, Mallika Sherawat, Rekha and Jaya Prada in pivotal roles.

Vishwaroopam, 2013

Vishwaroopam is a spy thriller that narrates the story of a man who leads two different lives in the movie. The man named Vishwanath portrays the role of a Kathak dance teacher and an undercover intelligence agent. Vishwanath embarks on a mission to unveil a terrorist plot that threatens the security of the nation. The movie was directed by Kamal Haasan himself and it featurs Rahul Bose, Shekhar Kapur and Jaideep Ahlawat, among others, in pivotal roles.

Vishwaroopam 2, 2018

Following the success of the first part released in 2013, Haasan directed the second part and released it in 2018, which continued the story of the protagonist. It delved deeper into his past and the mission shown in the first part. The same cast reprised their roles in the sequel.

Vettaiyaadu Vilaiyaadu, 2006

Vettaiyaadu Vilaiyaadu is a crime thriller film based on the life of a senior police officer, who investigates a series of brutal murders targeting young women. The film is known for the element of suspense, drama and action. It was released in 2006 featuring Jyothika, Prakash Raj and Salim Baig, among others.

Papanasam, 2015

The film narrates the story of a cable TV operator and his family, who gets entangled in a crime investigation after the son of the inspector general of police goes missing. The movie was a Tamil remake of filmmaker Jeethu Joseph’s 2013 Malayalam film Drishyam. Kamal Haasan’s co-stars here are Gautami, Asha Sarath, Nivetha Thomas.
